item.description:

item.title: Street furniture reported a year ago not fixed, 30th December
item.description:
This report is to formally raise concerns regarding an ongoing lighting issue that was first reported to the Council in January 2024 and again in June 2024. Despite multiple notifications, no remedial action has been taken to date. The lack of adequate lighting has resulted in the affected area, particularly the alleyway, becoming extremely dark during evening and night-time hours, creating a significant safety risk to residents and members of the public. As a direct consequence of the poor lighting conditions, a disabled mobility scooter has collided with the obstruction in this area, highlighting the seriousness of the hazard and the foreseeable risk of further incidents, including injury. This issue has been reported several times without resolution. Given the continued inaction and the escalation of risk, this matter now requires urgent attention. Failure to address the lighting deficiency presents an ongoing danger and may expose the Council to further incidents and liability. If no prompt action is taken, this issue will need to be formally escalated through the appropriate channels.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springhead Road, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
